result.execSummary:
The defendant Enrique L Fonseca was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Enrique L Fonseca is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Enrique L Fonseca was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to prison term defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution joint and several with co defendant. Restitution due during term of extended supervision. The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Court costs due during term of extended supervision. Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

-AODA and any counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
- No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Random tests.
-Maintain employment of at least 24 hours per week.
-No contact with co-defendant, co-defendant's mother or victim Michael Arndt.
-Defendant may not enter or shop at a Pawn shop.
-Submit DNA sample.
-Pay supervision fees.
